Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: The 2020 Dome Fire was a large and ecologically destructive wildfire in the Mojave National Preserve in California's San Bernardino County. Caused by a lightning strike on August 15, the fire began near Cima Dome (a geological formation for which the fire was named) and exhibited rapid growth over the following 36 hours, aided by weather conditions and a lack of available firefighting resources.

Location_with_Annotation.Cima Dome: The fire began near Cima Dome (a geological formation for which the fire was named) and exhibited rapid growth over the following 36 hours...
Location_with_Annotation.Mojave National Preserve: The 2020 Dome Fire was a large and ecologically destructive wildfire in the Mojave National Preserve in California's San Bernardino County.
Location_with_Annotation.Deer Spring: The fire began after one such lightning strike near Deer Spring, an old ranching qanat located on Cima Dome...
Location_with_Annotation.Baker area: In addition to the wind, temperatures remained extremely high; in the Baker area 20 miles to the west of the fire, temperatures reached a high of 117 degrees on August 17.
Location_with_Annotation.Morning Star Mine Road: The fire's advance was stopped at Morning Star Mine Road to the east...
Location_with_Annotation.Powerline Road: ...stopped at Morning Star Mine Road to the east, Powerline Road to the south...
Location_with_Annotation.Aiken Mine Road: ...stopped at Morning Star Mine Road to the east, Powerline Road to the south, near Aiken Mine Road to the west...
Location_with_Annotation.Cima Road: ...near the intersection of Cima Road and Zinc Mine Road south of Striped Mountain to the north.
Location_with_Annotation.Zinc Mine Road: ...near the intersection of Cima Road and Zinc Mine Road south of Striped Mountain to the north.
Location_with_Annotation.Teutonia Peak Trail: Trails and facilities in the immediate of the area were closed for safety, including the Teutonia Peak Trail...
Location_with_Annotation.Kessler Springs Historical Ranch House: Historic structures that burned included Kessler Springs Historical Ranch House...
Location_with_Annotation.Kessler Springs Ranch: ...bunkhouses at Kessler Springs Ranch and Valley View Ranch...
Location_with_Annotation.Valley View Ranch: ...bunkhouses at Kessler Springs Ranch and Valley View Ranch...
Location_with_Annotation.Morning Star Mine: Historic mining operations, such as the Morning Star Mine and Evening Star Mine, were threatened but ultimately spared.
Location_with_Annotation.Evening Star Mine: Historic mining operations, such as the Morning Star Mine and Evening Star Mine, were threatened but ultimately spared.

Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Lightning: Caused by a lightning strike on August 15
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Thunderstorm: This led to a dry thunderstorm outbreak across California
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Heatwave: Due to a strong high pressure system to California's west, in mid-August temperatures were abnormally hot statewide, including in the High Desert
Perils_Assessment_With_Annotation.Wildfire: The 2020 Dome Fire was a large and ecologically destructive wildfire in the Mojave National Preserve in California's San Bernardino County

Total_Summary_Building_Damage.Total_Building_Damage_Annotation: During this period the Dome Fire destroyed only 6 structures, but burned more than a quarter of the Cima Dome Joshua tree forest, one of the largest and densest populations of Joshua trees known in the world.
